result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Joseph Verjinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Called at 10:55 AM. Also called 13CM299 and 14CF25. Michael Verjinski appears in person and with counsel Michael Rielly. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - 13CM299 - amend only count to count ordinance of DC with fine of $300 plus costs; 13CF242 - #1 - amend to 943.23(3m) - operating without owners consent - class A misd - plead G - probation for 3 years with conditions of court costs, #2 - DRI, #3 - plead G - restitution owed to City of Crandon of $5071.00 (includes VW surcharge of $461.00) - have complied with victim notification requirements and have submitted correspondence, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with other conditions of: AODA and follow thru, restitution - paid thru probation at no less than $100.00/month on or before the 15th of every month - file state and federal tax return on or before 4/15 of each year and provide copies to P&P and surrender any returns due him until restitution is paid in full, absolute sobreity, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, 70 hours of community service; 14CF25 - plead to counts #1 and #2 as alleged - court costs only, #3 - DRI. Court has question regarding length of probation. State responds. Court instructs State to review statutes to find authority to assess 3 years probation. Rielly and Verjinski agree to plea agreement as stated by State. Court - 13CM299 - court amends only count to county ordinance of DC - pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300 plus costs totalling $582.50 - paid at rate of $100.00/month commencing 8/1/14/CO; 13CF242 - court amends count #1 to opearting without owners consent contrary to 943.23(3m) - reads new penalties - pleads G; DRI #2, pleads G to #3 as alleged; 14CF25 - pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, DRI #3. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constituitonal rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State has reviewed the statute and will let Court address the probation time - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Rielly makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Verjinski withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 13CF242 - counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation as follows: #1 - court costs - 1 year probation, #3 - court costs - 3 years probation, restitution owed to City of Crandon of $5071.00 (includes VW surcharge of $461.00) - have complied with victim notification requirements and have submitted correspondence, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with other conditions of: AODA and follow thru, restitution - paid thru probation at no less than $100.00/month on or before the 15th of every month - file state and federal tax return on or before 4/15 of each year and provide copies to P&P and surrender any returns due him until restitution is paid in full, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain GED, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, 70 hours of community service total, submit DNA sample with no surcharge assessed; 14CF25 - counts #1 and #2 - court costs only - paid at same rate as 13CM299, DNA surcharge on count #2 of $200.00 - paid at same rate, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: to Withdrawl as Counsel

Called case number 13CF242 at 10:42 AM. Also called 13CM299 and 14CF25. Michael Verjinski appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns - off record conversation that the defendant does not want to accept the deals and also her verbal motion to withdraw as counsel as she feels there is a conflict for stated reasons. State provides court with state's recommendation. Verjinski states he was not aware that there was a plea offer. Burns informs court that she got the plea offer on Monday along with the discovery where she concluded that she then had a conflict - did discuss parts of the plea offer with the defendant (did not have the money to post that was required on cases). Court continues all cases, set all matters for JT on 7/10/14 at 8:30 AM. Burns will fax order to withdraw. Court respoonds - won't sign unless someone else is already appointed.
Jury trial on July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Called at 3:08 PM. Also called 14CF25 and 13CM299. Michael Verjinski appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believes both felonies will be waived and have filed Information that mirrors both complaints. Burns agrees. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Burns has Information for both cases and waives further reading of those, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts on all cases. Court continues bond on all cases, sets all matters for FPT on 4/23/14 at 10:00 am.

Called at 10:53 AM. Michael Verjinski appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns has complaint but has not had a chance to review it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns was a PH, asks for set when other case is set on 3/12/14 at 3:00 PM. Court sets for PH on 3/12/14 at 3:00 PM. Burns - bond - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - reduces bond to $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no operation of a motor vehicle, notify the Court within 24 hours of any change in address.
